intro: Scutellaria rhomboidalis, commonly known as the rhomboid skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and features small, lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are usually blue to violet in color, with two lips that are characteristic of the mint family. Scutellaria rhomboidalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
